revisionDesc.change: Finalized - Ready. As the new edition of this text in P.Vet. Aelii 1 does in fact present the text of the verso in precisely the same manner as was the case in PSI 8 928 (and the nature of the text on the verso is scarcely classifiable on the basis on what is left), I decided not to separate the text on the verso and not to create a new file for it.
Vote - AcceptText - See Sosins comments and add: 5: => <#δευ̣τέρ̣α̣ς=2> 6-7: add num tag 14: => ε.6σαν

Vote - AcceptText - Accept. Lin1--> 0. lost.?lin; lin10,14 del /*?*/; lin15--> [.1].7[.?]. For verso, which comes from PSI 8.928 and which P.Vet.Ael. does not republish: here leave only a note in the verso div: /*1. for verso see PSI 8 928*/. Then, upon renaming retain dummy header. Then, before finalizing, open PSI 8.928, enter a recto div with /*1. recto republished as P.Vet.Aelii 1*/ and with a verso div containing 1. $m2 vestig.?lin 2. γεουχοῦντας ἐν κώμῃ Ἀνκ[υρώνων ][.?] 3. lost.?lin
Add dummy header for original identifier 'papyri.info/ddbdp/psi;8;928' pointing to new identifier 'papyri.info/ddbdp/p.vet.aelii;;1'
Entered new information from P.Vet.Aelii digital file, in particular line 0. Proofread.
Automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
batch converted all tei:sic to tei:orig and tei:corr to tei:reg
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
